page.title: 03A PURBROOK MIDDLE SCHOOL
page.content: A typical Middle School in the area has 260 pupils. They are housed in a two-storey building with a hall,nine classrooms,a pottery room,a domestic science room,a T.V. room, offices and kitchen. The teaching staff consist of a headteacher and 11 teachers.There are 9 classes but the children are divided into sets for Mathematics and English. The children also are split into small groups for various "Option" subjects. These include needlework, woodwork,pottery,cookery,computer studies and craftwork. The day starts at 9.00am and school finishes at 3.30 pm. There is a break for lunch of an hour and a quarter. Some children have a school dinner and others bring sandwiches from home. Games played by the children include football,netball rounders,athletics,badminton,tennis and volley ball.
